title: Make the Leading Coefficient "1"
text: Divide by the leading coefficient on both sides which gives $${\left(a+2\right)}^2=40$$.
speech: Divide by the leading coefficient on both sides which gives  parentheses a plus 2,  squared is equal to 40 .

title: Use Square Root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=\sqrt{k}$$. $${\left(a+2\right)}^2=40$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$a+2=\sqrt{40}$$ or $$a+2=-\sqrt{40}$$.

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$2{\left(a+2\right)}^2=80$$ has two solutions which are $$a=-2-2\sqrt{10}$$, and $$a=-2+2\sqrt{10}$$.
speech: Therefore,  2 times, parentheses a plus 2,  squared is equal to 80  has two solutions which are  a, is equal to negative 2 minus, 2 the square root of 10 , and  a is equal to, negative 2 plus, 2 the square root of 10 .
